Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the impact of Obamacare on job loss by stating that it would cost 800,000 jobs.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support as it is based on the testimony of the head of the Congressional Budget Office, but it is not clear if there is additional evidence or research to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the implementation of Obamacare is directly responsible for the loss of 800,000 jobs, without considering other factors that may contribute to job loss.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the job loss, such as economic factors or other policies, that are not addressed in the claim.
